q: The maximum combined length of the command-line arguments including the spaces between adjacent arguments is
options: It may vary from one operating system to another

q: According to ANSI specifications which is the correct way of declaring main when it receives command-line arguments?
options:
int main(argc, argv)
int argc; char *argv;

q: What do the 'c' and 'v' in argv stands for?
options: 'c' means argument control 'v' means argument vector
'c' means argument count 'v' means argument vertex
'c' means argument count 'v' means argument vector
'c' means argument configuration 'v' means argument visibility
